arm_group.description: patients with intellectual disability or psycho-motor retardation and their parents and sibs (affected or not)

brief_summary.textblock:
Intellectual disability (ID) occurs in 2 to 3 % of the general population but the cause is
      identified only in 30 to 60% of cases.

      The purpose of this study is to indentify genes involved in ID with new genetics tools
      (SNP-arrays, next generation sequencing...) and establish genotype-phenotype correlations.

clinical_study.brief_title: Research and Characterization of New Genes Involved in Intellectual Disability

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  for the patients: Clinical diagnosis of intellectual disbility

          -  for the unaffected sibs: to be aged at least 3 years

          -  informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  absence of informed consent

study_pop.textblock:
-  2500 patients with intellectuel disability

          -  5000 parents or unaffected sibs

          -  1000 affected sibs

facility.name: CRICM - UPMC/Inserm UMR_S975/CNRS UMR7225, Groupe Hospitalier de la Pitié-Salpêtrière,

clinical_study.official_title: Recherche et caractérisation de Nouveaux gènes impliqués Dans la déficience Intellectuelle.

overall_official.affiliation: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants for which the causative gene of intellectual disability will be identified and number of genes involved in intellectual disability identified with new technologies including microarray and next generation sequencing
primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with genetic cause identified

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Nava C, Lamari F, Héron D, Mignot C, Rastetter A, Keren B, Cohen D, Faudet A, Bouteiller D, Gilleron M, Jacquette A, Whalen S, Afenjar A, Périsse D, Laurent C, Dupuits C, Gautier C, Gérard M, Huguet G, Caillet S, Leheup B, Leboyer M, Gillberg C, Delorme R, Bourgeron T, Brice A, Depienne C. Analysis of the chromosome X exome in patients with autism spectrum disorders identified novel candidate genes, including TMLHE. Transl Psychiatry. 2012 Oct 23;2:e179. doi: 10.1038/tp.2012.102.

secondary_outcome.description: Explore genotype-phenotype correlations when a new gene involved in intellectual disability will be identified
secondary_outcome.time_frame: genotype-phenotype correlations (according to the genes identified in a period of 5 years)

clinical_study.source: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
